content.description: One of the coolest climbs to stumble on in the area. It begins with a great swing into a jug then goes vertical real quick. I don't want to spoil it for ya but it is definetely worth the hike! Have fun on the top-out
content.location: In the northeast corner as you reach the top

content.description: Probably the best/easiest way to get on top of mushroom boulder given that any other route has a graphic landing. Still fun, juggy climbing with the down climb down the same route being slightly harder but not difficult. Good access route for TR for other routes on this boulder if bolts are ever placed. Otherwise, a fun warmup with many variations.
content.location: The largest boulder on the mesa in the back (North) side of the area. A large oak tree sits on the west side of it for reference. This route sits on the back right side of the mushroom boulder (northeast corner)

content.description: Crux is the start with a difficult pull off the deck. Leads to two good feet and a reach just below the top. Good boulder problem that takes some grit.
content.location: Center of the wave area in the south cluster of boulders. It sits atop another boulder. Coordinates: Longitude (33.0123) latitude (-116.7798)

content.description: Fun little boulder problem with undercling. Route mostly goes up the right side of the boulder as variation to the left makes it easier.
content.location: Southwest region of the wave area
